Reviews.Title: “Not Quite What Was Advertised As In Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Don L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was hard to find, despite having the address written down, we were beginning to think we had been ripped off and that the hotel did not exist as there was no visible signage. Once we found the buzzer by the closed door we were directed to reception on the 2nd floor - we chose not to use the lift as it looked dangerous. We were disppointed to find the facilities in our room did not match those on the confirmation printout - we certainly DID NOT have the Alarm Clock, CD Player, DVD Player, Flat Screen TV, Slippers or MP3 Player listed. And our fridge was not working, and the shrug of the shoulders that we were given when we pointed this out did not stop our food going off. The staff ranged from good to useless, depending on who was on duty. The breakfast was the worst we came across in Italy, being a very limited choice and stale. The breakfast room itself was tiny, and sitting down and getting things to eat was an awkward exercise even if you could find an empty table. The luggage room did not exist - we left our bags in the corridor beside the reception desk, along with several other guests. We tried to use the PC in the lobby to check in onine for our return flight, but the internet would not connect - the staff member on duty was watching cricket on the hotel PC at the time, so this may have had something to do with it. Again the response was a shrug of the shoulders. The bed was one of the most uncomfortable we came across during our travel through Italy. On the plus side, our room was a good size, with large windows which opened onto the street below, and it was clean. The hotel was convenient for sightseeing, though it was a reasonable walk to The Vatican City, etc. But there was plenty to look at on the way. We stayed for three nights, which we had pre-paid, but would have rather paid a little more to get the facilities as advertised, and listed on our confirmation, somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Kyle R
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't within walking distance of any of the tourist attractions. The staff was terrible and even yelled at us for coming in too late. No one was available to help us lug our bags upstairs in the rickety elevator. The breakfast was weak and we even walked in to find no seats because the waitress what sitting down eating. The rooms were clean enough but the mattress was as hard as a rock. Definitely one of my least favorite hotels ever!

Reviews.Title: “look elsewhere when staying in rome..”
Reviews.Author: anitahol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and we were quite happy with the rooms but extremely disappointed with the service provided by this hotel.. The rooms are quite nice, quite spacious for rome, with a minibar which is very handy to put some food and drinks in, aircon, fairly new bathrooms (at times a bit smelly due to the sewer gas). But don't expect a room with a view coz the only view you will get is a brick wall! The service though very disappointing.. most of the staff is quite rude and makes you feel like you are quite an inconvenience. The worst experience we had was on the last day when we had to check out. There was the cleaning/breakfast lady at the check in desk and when it was time to pay I am not sure she had any idea of how to use to FPOS machine and just kept on swearing and punching in numbers and swiping our credit cards very impatiently on 3 different machines about 10 times and nothing was working.. she kept on blaming it on the "busy lines". We got very frustrated as we were getting quite worried that our cards where getting charged every time they where swiped.. we asked if someone else that worked there could try and when finally someone else came he processed the payment and it worked on the first go.. obviously the lady was doing something wrong but would not admit it and kept on blaming the lines. I thought she was very unprofessional. Breakfast is also a big disappointment, very basic with little or no food, stale bread and pastries, and the breakfast rooms is way to small first of all and people are left outside at reception waiting for a table to clear. The hotels location is ok, theres a bakery at the front which can make fresh sandwiches and a nice little restaurant next door, but its also a bit of a walk from the main sites, definitely worth paying a bit more and staying somewhere more central. Would not stay here again and personally would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Rmalago
Reviews.Content: If I had read all this reviews before I would not have stayed there. But the hotel is not so bad for it's price. It's old, but the main complain of other reviews of not finding the hotel is simple, if you write it down the address 15, Via Quintino Sella you arrive in a building which has indicated in the intercom Hotel Invictus. The staff is friendly, and it is quite well located. You are 20 minutes walking from Piazza de Spagna and other places and for the wine lovers the best Rome Wine Bar "i Colore del Vino" is steps away. Don't expect any luxury or anything else, but is simply a decent bed for you to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy, central hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: bgworld15
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay in this pleasant hotel. The staff were very friendly, fluent in English and very helpful. Breakfast was simple (croissants, breads, cereal, hard-boiled eggs, coffee/tea, juice) but completely sufficient to get one going. Interior (courtyard) room was very quiet, as long as you don't mind having nothing to look at. Great restaurants in easy walking distance, coffee shop / grocery across the street, metro stop 5 minute walk and Termini Station 10 mins away without luggage - or 8-10 Euro by taxi. The hotel is only marked by a small brass plaque at street level. Buzz the hotel at the street door or head inside if it's open, up to the second floor to find the reception. It also goes by the name "Hotel Re".

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Kiret
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a 4-night stay at the Hotel Invictus to spend a long weekend with my partner in Rome. It was actually 3 nights however because the first night we had to go round the corner to another (2*) hotel because of 'plumbing problems' in the room, albeit this was handled very well with minimal fuss and we weren't too bothered about it. Then coming to stay in the hotel Invictus, the initial impression of the room was a good one, it seemed very clean with some natural light in from the window and was adequate for our needs. We only really wanted somewhere to get some sleep inbetween exploring the fabulous city outside! However, we did have a few issues with the hotel, on the first morning there we went to breakfast (as it was included when we booked online), there was a little bread, a small packet of french toast with some butter and small sachets of jam and the suggestion of there having been cereal earlier on. We sat down in the noisy and small breakfast room but was ignored by the staff. In the end we decided not to bother and left to seek something to eat on-the-go. According to the hotel if we had wanted to pay for the breakfast (if it was not included) this would have cost us about 7 euros per person! - definitely not worth the money in my opinion - instead go to the panini shop over the road! Couple of points about the room itself, the shower was good but seemed to be lacking a door - resulting in quite a lot of water on the bathroom floor, also the TV worked but had no English language channels whatsoever (the 2* hotel did have BBC world news). The quality of sleep I had at this hotel was regrettably poor, the pillows were flat and provided little support and there was no duvet, just a sheet and a rather thin blanket. We had to have the noisy heater on all night to prevent from waking up with the cold! As well as this the street noise with the window shut was still very loud and disturbed our sleep in the mornings, some double glazing would have been much appreciated. In all, I would not recommend this hotel, I would have been happier to go back to the two star one!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: bbono001
Reviews.Content: Our trip started off badly to begin with since Orbitz wouldn't fix a booking error between our original hotel. The staff was OK except for the Indian guy who worked the front desk; he was tremendously rude and made us feel like an inconvenience. The hotel is a dump, bad location from most of the major sites in the historical center. You have to ring the front desk just to get into the building, the elevator is "shaky" at best, and the computer in the hallway didn't even work. Not to mention the horrible smell from the restroom; the entire trip (5 nights) we were nauseated by the smell of sewer gas. We were forced to run the water all night just to be able to stay in the room. The hotel staff did not accomodate our needs and blamed it on the old building. The AC didn't work the whole trip and the TV wouldn't until the rude Indian guy finally came up to the room to troubleshoot the problem. The room did not have hangers to hang our clothes and the cleaning staff did not always bring fresh towels when they made up the room. This hotel is not worth the stay; its way too far from the main sites and its not worth the hassel. I love Rome and this was my 3rd time visiting... I'd just hope that if you are debating chosing this hotel you take this negative comments seriously when making your final decision. Very dissapointed with my stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Too far away, bad breakfast, too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Da
Reviews.Content: In principle OK, but - The rooms are somehow stylish but not well maintained - The whole building is very strange and dark. The Hotel is only in the 2-5 floor. Rest is occupied by business companies. You have to ring a bell that somebody lets you in. - Breakfast room is too small. People have to wait. - Breakfast is not good - Location is compared to the price too far away (Hotel Solis (same manager) is better located). You have to walk 10 mins to the next train station. - Service is OK but it took me several days to get my money back from a Taxi transfer. I think there are better Hotels to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: ripper_026
Reviews.Content: We were originally suppose to stay at the hotel Best Roma, but were told the hotel was under renovation and we had no room. So after a long day of travelling, we were moved to the Invictus, but had to pay for our own cab to get there. The room we were originally given was small and was also the storage spot for the maid's cleaning equipment. We were moved to a better room, but the room was next to the front desk. The walls are paper thin, so my wife and I were kept awake by the telephone ringing, and our neighbour snoring. All in all, a bad experience...

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel Invictus Roma”
Reviews.Author: Strollingalong
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean cozy hotel, centrally located with friendly knowledgeable staff. Great location for sites. Walking distance to Termini and Barberini metro. Continental breakfast (cereal/juice/rolls/croissants/tea/coffee) and plenty of it. Good sized room with fridge, tv and en suite. Entrance is shared by apartments with hotel being top two floors so with two entrances it felt very safe. Sat tv has only one english speaking channel (CNN) but then who goes to Rome to watch tv! Great winter deal when booked direct. Lovely corner deli/cafe opposite hotel at very reasonable prices. All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: JohnDenver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel through Expedia.com. Expedia states this 'hotel' has free internet, free parking & full breakfast. They had none of the above! No internet, no free parking (unless you consider free parking to be a free space in any street in Rome), and certainly no 'full breakfast'. This isn't even a hotel, never mind a 3 star one. It's like any apartment block in Rome. You take an old, communal lift (with other residents of the block) to an apartment on the 2nd floor ("reception") and they give you a key to an apartment on the 4th or 5th floor. The walls are PAPER THIN! We were kept awake for 3 nights running by people next door partying 'til 3am. When we called down to complain several times it rang out. We asked for the manager on countless occasions who was, surprise surprise, never there. Even Expedia themselves couldn't get a hold of him when they tried to contact him with my complaints. It is relatively close to several places of interest (Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Via Del Corso etc), but so are hundreds of other REAL hotels with superior accommodation and facilities at a similar price. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of fraud”
Reviews.Author: davidc1983
Reviews.Content: Beware of fraud! I recently took my girlfriend to Rome to celebrate the New Year and the whole thing was wrecked by the fraudulent people who run this hotel. They charged us twice for the 'privilege' of staying there - taking my credit card details from the booking I made via their website to make a second charge. When I confronted them about this, they said everything would be sorted out, but it never was! It would be sorted in the morning... It would be sorted in the afternoon... Now the bank is closed... Now they refuse to answer any correspondence. Once again, please be aware, I wouldn't like this to happen to other tourists that they think will never visit Rome again. Do not give them your credit card details via their website! While we were there, the young Italian man on the counter and the Indian who speaks no English attempted to cover up their little fraud scheme, claiming it was a misunderstanding. They regularly said they would clear it up but always found an excuse not to. As of yet they still owe us close to 400 Euros. Our credit card company are currently investigating the hotel for fraud (in other words, they made it clear to us that there are a number of cases pending on this hotel)... Another trick used by this bunch of crooks are saying you have used things in the minibar that you haven't (in this case, leaving half-empty drinks in there). That only added insult to injury. I post here because I picked this hotel partly based on the recommendations here. I would hate for anyone else to have their time in Rome wrecked by the thieves of Hotel Invictus. Be aware!!

Reviews.Title: “suprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: SussexMitten
Reviews.Content: After seeing previous reviews I was very concerned about staying at this hotel. However I found this hotel secure, clean and well situated for a good price. The Hotel is entered by a intercom system which when you arrive for the first time is not the easiest to find, you then enter via a locked door which to be honest made me feel the security was excellent. You only have to climb 2 floors of stairs, unless you are disabled there really is no need to take the lift. The rooms are nicely decorated and the bathrooms were spotlessly clean with plenty of space. The staff were all friendly and welcoming and the hotel is situated within 10 mins walking distance of Termini station but not close enough for the area to be dodgy. The Breakfast was lovely, fresh coffee and various types of pastries and bread rolls all placed on the table when you arrive. There are also juices, teas and cereals. Remember this is a 2 star hotel in a major city - I think it was great value for money and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Redbubble77
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Last minute.com & couldve kicked myself after id paid & found out it was cheaper to book direct (Supposed to have been a special rate!) When we arrived at the Hotel Invictus it was very poorly marked & we almost walked past it. You access the hotel by pressing a buzzer & they tell you to come up to the 2nd floor. You reach the floors via a rickety old lift (but then th ebuilding is very old anyway). When we got there we checked in & were given instructions to go up to the 4th floor. We went up & could find nothing with Hotel Invictus on it - there were allsorts of businesses in the other rooms. So we had to go back down to the reception again & get the man to take us back up. The room was behind a door on the left as we came out of the lift. Entry is gained with a key card. Once through the door there are 5 bedrooms, also accessed with the key card. The bedroom was reasonably sized & there was a queen sized bed in the room. Although the hotels website promises a dvd player, cd layer & lcd tv in the room, we only had the lcd tv & could only get 1 channel in English. The bathroom was a fair size, but the shower wasnt so big. The 1st day there the water was lukewarm, but bearable-just. The 2nd morning when we got up & went to have a shower there was no hot water at all. I spoke to reception & was told that they were waiting for it to be repaired that day. That night we had fantastic hot showers, which were much needed as the room was freezing! The next morning (Our last) the hot water had disappeared again. Although the location was central & far enough away from the nightime perils of Termini station (pickpockets, etc), i wouldnt book to stay there again. I must say that for a 2 star hotel it was very clean & well decorated, but the unreliability of the plumbing really put a dampner on the trip. Although we had breakfast booked,we didnt bother getting up to go and have it, so i cant comment on the food standards im afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room. Okay Service. Not so great location.”
Reviews.Author: K787565
Reviews.Content: You have to carry your luggage up to the 1st floor (which is our '2nd' floor in the U.S.) then from there you can hop in a tiny freight style elevator which will take you up to the "hotel" floor(s). The entire building is not just for hotel Invictus. They are simply on one or two floors in this building. The stair case was steep and dirty and the elevator was "rikity" and very small. Once we arrived in our room, however, my wife and I were PLEASANTLY surprised. It was VERY clean, modern, and fairly quiet. I do recommend this hotel if you're okay with a good bit of walking because it isn't very close to any of the major attractions in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel RE (aka Invictus)”
Reviews.Author: scotabroad57
Reviews.Content: The initial problem was that I booked 3 nights at the Hotel RE not the Invictus. There was no Hotel RE at the correct address, this did cause a bit of a concern when we arrived, I thought we had been ripped off! After asking a local shopkeeper, we were pointed to a door to an apartment block, and rang the bell of the only hotel listed, the Invictus. It turns out this was the correct hotel as they had our booking, no explanation on the two hotel names was forthcoming. Room was great, but aircon did not work and toilet tended to run all night when flushed. Strangest hotel ever, was actually converted apartments over several non sequential floors. Expensive for what it was at £120 per night. There is a suberb cafe across the road on the corner, does a great breakfast of; freshly squeezed OJ, cafe latte and pastry for €3.30! Location pretty good, easy 15 minute walk from Termini Station, 15 minutes walk from both Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, 10 minutes from Metro Station at Piazza Berberini. Not sure I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: puribunga
Reviews.Content: The entry area was a little different, having to ring the bell everytime we wanted to get into the hotel, it was a little akward after a night out... Besides this small issue, it was a great little hotel within easy walking distance to all areas a normal visitor would want to see. A taxi ride to most areas was only about 10 euros (max). One of the guys at reception was specially nice and cheerful, and great on advice on just about everything. Rooms were very clean, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms are quite big, extremely clean, very cozy. Service is quite good, few people but very competent.

Reviews.Title: “Room alright, service terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to stay at this little hotel after reading the reviews about this hotel. The entrance for the hotel was really spooky and dirty!. Once you go to the second floor, you are greeted by the receptionist who doesn't speak english but he was helpful. The room i was in was of a good size( big enough for me to open my luggages) and the room was tidy and clean. Toilet was clean but there are cracks on the tub and toilet sit. But the worst part of the the room was the air conditioning. There was no cold air, it was warm air! I find it difficult to slept and i can't open the window in the room because it was facing the back part of the building which was not a pleasant sight. I went to complain this to the receptionist ( By now, it's a different receptionist. He is of "Indian nationality" ), he doesn't seem to care about it. He was extremely unhelpful and rude!. He doesn't even look at you when you try to speak to him. Although he does speak abit of english, he is by far the rudest person i met in rome. The location is good, with lots of good cafe and restaurants around it. There is a nice pizzeria near the hotel. Try the starter " the soute " ( fresh mussel and clams in garlic and olive oil ) It's delicious! Basically this hotel is ok if they hired better receptionist and fixed the air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great little central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fluffybunnytail
Reviews.Content: I read a terrible review about the Hotel Invictus before I stayed there and I was a but intrepid about staying there but I have to say that it was a pretty good hotel. Nearly all of the hotels in Rome have a buzzer entrance on the door and the hotel building do not look very grand on the outside - unless you are staying in a 5 star hotel and for this you will pay a pretty penny. The rooms were very well decorated in a very plush design with amtico flooring and it was exceptionally, sparklingly clean. The breakfast was really lovely with the best coffee that I had in Rome and the freshest buns served up by a lovely Italian mama. The only gripe I had about this hotel was that the main hotel is on the second floor and aswell as rooms on the second floor they have rooms up on the fifth floor. On the fifth floor it is basically an apartment that has an electronic bar code on the door and when you get beyond this door there are a lot of separate little hotel rooms. For me I don't like lifts and if you also don't like lifts then it's a steep climb to the fifth floor!!! Overall though this hotel is well decorated, friendly and has free internet access!!! I'd recommend it!!! The Spanish steps is a 20 minute walk from the hotel

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Invictus Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via Quintino Sella 15, 00187 Rome, Italy
